key_points: A special congressional committee created to investigate the January 6 storming of the US Capitol will hear from police officers assaulted during the incident.
The hearing will feature the first public testimony from officers since the event occurred six months ago.
The incident was spurred by former President Donald Trump and claims that the November 2020 election was stolen.
Five people died, and dozens of police were wounded during the insurrection.
There is ongoing political debate over the depth of investigation into the event, with significant Republican opposition.
Maryland Representative Jamie Raskin, a Democrat on the panel, emphasizes the importance of the officers' testimonies.
The investigation faces GOP opposition, with House Republican leadership pulling appointments to the panel after Democratic objections.
Speaker Nancy Pelosi appointed two Republicans critical of Trump to the panel, amid GOP attempts to discredit the probe.
Four police officers are set to testify about their brutal experiences during the riot.
On the same day as the hearing, Republican legislators plan to hold a news conference to highlight the treatment of arrested rioters.
spokespersons: Nancy Pelosi (Democratic Speaker of the House)
